page.title: 17Wildlife in Wellington
page.content: Being a very rural area we are well endowed with wildlife.There are a number of varing habitats in which fauna and flora can exist in relative peace. One major habitat is the decidious woodland on the Blackdown Hills. Within this woodland live at least one family of Foxes, Badgers ,Blackbirds Wood Warblers,Woodpeckers and many other common species.The wood is mainly made up of Beech trees but there is also a number of oaks and some Dutch Elm.On the slopes below the wood there is an untouched meadowland in which grow some Meadow Orchid or Early Marsh Orchid. There is a large Rookery just opposite Pyles Thorne road.A number of Buzzards can be seen flying over head and kestrels are regulary seen hovering over the motorway verges.
